website_summaries.verdict: A large, sturdy steel hitch step that also doubles as extra bumper protection.
pros: Provides extra protection for your bumper against scratches and dents
cons: Some users have said that the step rusts over time

customer_reviews.title: I love my Bully Bar!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Bully bar! Not only does it provide a perfect (and much needed) third step on my Nissan Armada, the other day it saved me from a whole hell of a lot of damage when I was rear ended in a 3 car pile up. A Honda hit a Dodge truck which hit me. The Honda had to be towed away. Today I replaced the hitch as it was pretty well damaged. I had the hitch on this vehicle for about 2 years and a Nissan Parhfinder for about 4 years (so they last!). For $50 this little bit of insurance paid for itself X 100. Happy motoring.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: The Bully Trailer Hitch Step arrived very quickly, but to my surprise it arrived damaged. It was in original packaging which I don't think could be opened and then put back together, so the product was not used. HOWEVER, there were scratches over the entire thing - and painted over with a sharpie/marker!! The rubber end caps were also covered in some weird material. I am returning this and buying a new one - will update once that comes in ( we'll see if I don't have to return the next one...)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best protection for your rear bumper!
customer_reviews.text: Was rearened yesterday by a Honda CRV going over 20mph - my Billy Step took the full impact and saved my 2005 Sequoias rear bumper! Not a mark on my bumper - Bully Step is dented and the plastic grip came off but saved the day! Best $47 I ever spent and saved me hundreds in repairs. Will definitely be buying a replacement. Edit - just ordered and received my replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Heisenberg

customer_reviews.title: I’m Happy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in “good condition” off warehouses deals. It arrived in two days and was in “Perfect Condition”! Step appears to be very sturdy. Install on my 2015 F150 was easy as expected. I put two strips of gorilla tape around it before inserting it into the receiver and it fit as snug as a bug in a rug. I put the pin through the center hole and the bully step sits perfectly for me. And the step doesn’t trigger any warnings from my back up sensors. So overall I am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rockinusa

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive alternative
customer_reviews.text: This step is just as described. It is lightweight and for the Tacoma will probably help in slow speed bumps.Since people don't know how to park anymore this may save minor bumps. Yes it will rattle, Nothing that some tape wrap wont't fix. Since this is at the end of a pick-up you don't hear any rattle. Please note that this will only protect the center of the vehicle. The vehicle corners are still vulnerable. It seems like it would support as a step bumper.
customer_reviews.author: KAG

customer_reviews.title: Great for parking in close quarters
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic for those of use who park in close quarters in the city. It's even great for when you park in large lots as people can't park so close to your bumper you can't load purchases into the back of your SUV. I chose this over other ones like WeatherTech due to the curved design. I'd be hitting my shins or knees into the rectangular designs. In only a week three people asked me where I got this so they can get one too.
customer_reviews.author: Prime member

customer_reviews.title: Solid but poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty solid. Mine came with scratches down to the metal, I’ll need to paint it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy hitch step...
customer_reviews.text: Would have been 5 stars but the first one I received had the step welded to the hitch slightly out of square which caused the step to look like it wasn't parallel with the bumper or the ground. Return/replacement was easy, I love the fact you can drop off returns at Kohl's now, what a time saver. Anyway, received the replacement and it was welded properly. I guess the first one slipped through QC.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: ULTIMATE PROTECTION FROM CAERLEES DRIVERS
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today. Well packaged and a very nice addition to a truck or car. I would not leave the driveway without one of these. Know why? Just price a bumper and when you are attacked from behind by a cell phone user, it really screws their front bumper and grills up.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. David J. Emmons

customer_reviews.title: Go Ahead and Bang My Bumper Now!
customer_reviews.text: Within a week of bying my new truck, some fool bangned into my rear painted bumper, thus marking the paint. NO MORE! This baby bolted right into my standard hitch receiver and I dare ssomeoen to bump my truck again. Bonus is this serves as a third step (my Chevrolet has the built in steps on each side of rear bumper). Now, I will admit it "rattled" a bit, but a few thin shims of the sides eliminated that (was not noisy, I just did not like miniscule loosness). Well made, sturdy and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe 12

customer_reviews.title: I installed this step several months ago and it gets ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed this step several months ago and it gets plenty of use. It definitely has saved some wear and tear on my knees from getting in and out of the truck bed. I also appreciate the curved edges. Anyone who has ever busted their shin on a receiver hitch knows what I'm talking about.
customer_reviews.author: SC Guy

customer_reviews.title: Plan to re-glue the caps yourself
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, works great, immensely bad machining job. The ends of the tube that are loosely covered by the rubber caps look like they were chewed off rather than machined / cut, and the rubber caps themselves seem to be held on by school glue, not anything fit for the job. Otherwise, and most importantly functionally, it's a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Equilibrium

customer_reviews.title: Saved me several hundred dollars
customer_reviews.text: Installed this on my 2019 Ram 1500 several months ago. Very sturdy, and quiet. A few days ago while backing up I didn't see a cement post sticking out of the ground. Thankfully it hit this step protector, bending it a little to one side. If this had hit my bumper it would cost about 2,000. to replace. Luckily it will cost less than 50 to replace this step protector. Already ordered ordered & received another one.
customer_reviews.author: Budde223

customer_reviews.title: Does not set off backup sensors on 2019 Ram 1500
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Looks good. Have not had a chance to evaluate for rattles but will update when I do. Was concerned that this would set off the rear sensors (like a larger model I tried), but it does not cause a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Nami

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give the Bully 4.5 stars. It is a very sturdy gauge steel and looks to do exactly what its intended to do. I feel better having it sticking out the back of my truck knowing that some @sshat is going to bump into me at a light while they are busy texting. Wrap a few times on the post with gorilla tape and it fits fine. Use a pin with lock. I dont like the rubber step or end caps which I am sure will come apart soon, but otherwise its solid.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Need some extra protection
customer_reviews.text: One of the best additions to my 2015 F150. It fits well, provided you attached the small rubberized sticker, which is included. It feels sturdy and well built. It has 2 functions, a step for the pickup bed (especially on a lifted truck) and a bumper for those careless drivers. Very easy installation. Worth every penny for some extra protection. I purchased the CURT 23518 Black Trailer Hitch Lock 5/8-Inch Pin Diameter Fits 2-Inch Receiver with this bumpstep.
customer_reviews.author: M. Leong

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Protection from Rear-End Hits
customer_reviews.text: While sitting in traffic, I was rear-ended by someone not paying attention to the fact that the vehicle in front of her was stopped. Luckily, the Bully BBS took the entire hit, deforming but not breaking. My car was otherwise unaffected. I was so impressed I immediately ordered a replacement to make sure that I was protected from the next idiot driver who felt texting was more important than looking where her car was going. This is cheap insurance to protect your car!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh, OK for the money
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, and this does not cost much. Thinner metal than I expected, rubber caps on ends of tubes barely cover the opening and dont seal out water. Mine seems to be welded crooked as it looked like its bent or curved. If you think of it's shape as a capital letter T, the top of it is not square to the leg. When installed it is not even close to parallel to my bumper. It is just a utilitarian item so I won't obsess over it.
customer_reviews.author: John from Milwaukee

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect for Tesla model X.
customer_reviews.text: It's almost perfect for my Tesla model X. It has 3 holes to lock in place and the stock model X tow hitch only allows you to go as deep as the 2nd hole. It sticks out slightly farther then I anticipated, but certainly not a problem. Easily holds 200 lbs when stepped on. Don't forget a hitch lock. I personally bought the CURT 23518 Black Trailer Hitch Lock to match up.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell G.

customer_reviews.title: End caps are rubber & a little cheap - cost was fair so overall this is a good item that I'm sure will get used & last
customer_reviews.text: Item works well as a step - no rear impacts so far so I'm not sure on parking lot durability. Will come in handy when loading a roof cargo rack & fastening things down. Item fits a little loose in receiver - is the receiver too big or was this item made a little small? Receiver was installed brand new (Curt) and I have other items that are a tighter fit. I suppose there will always be some play. End caps are rubber & a little cheap - cost was fair so overall this is a good item that I'm sure will get used & last.
customer_reviews.author: T. B.

customer_reviews.title: Like a thin metal sheet!
customer_reviews.text: September 2019, i bought this for the fact that many reviews says how durable it was and etc. Well... that's a lie. I’m in NYC, literally every suv has a front guard and rear protector of some kind. The bull piece was squashed flat from parking! Yes parking, parked my car on the street side. When I return, it was squashed. See pictures for reference, I should be thankful that it protected my bumper but i would expect this to atleast last some time and not 20 days. Looking into alternatives now.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but it’s a little loose
customer_reviews.text: So I bought a locking pin to go with this and this thing although it looks good, kinda tends to move around a little more than I thought it would. Not too concerned as it doesn’t look like it’s going to fly off my truck at a moments notice.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon P.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a nice stylist footrest
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy duty. The stem is solid 2" steel and heavy. I had to use an adapter to fit it into a 1 1/4" hitch which needed to be cut to fit. Also, I had to drill another 1/2" hole to accommodate the retaining pin as it stuck out too far from the bumper. Not easy to do unless you have the tools but looks really great on my Mazda SUV!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Seems fine to me
customer_reviews.text: just hooked it up, Seems fine. The plastic ends are a little loose, but they are inwards and won't get any impacts etc... As far as the fit , it is about the same as my trailer hitch, rattles a little but nothing that I noticed while driving at all. I guess if its a problem for some you can very easily wrap the shaft with a layer of gorilla tape to tighten up the fit? buts it's a non issue here. 2016 tacoma.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice addition to my truck.
customer_reviews.text: The bully bar helped clean up the appearance of the trailer hitch on my truck. It looks to add protection in the event of a rear end accident. The hitch is extremely sturdy, easily holds my 300 lb weight. Another awesome feature, is the multiple pin location holes in the shaft of the bully bar step to adjust how far it sticks from the vehicle's bumper.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: This Bully is a real head turner!
customer_reviews.text: This Bully is absolutely awesome. We have put it on our new Ford Everest 2019. Fits perfect, is sturdy, perfect to step onto. Well made product. Highly recommend this Bully to protect the back end of vehicle. Once fitted into tow hitch, it pretrudes out approximately 300mm. Has rubber caps on end of pipes but secured so they won’t fall off. These rubber caps can flex to let water out if need be. Highly recommend using a locking bolt through hitch so it doesn’t go walkabouts as it’s such a cool product.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Nice hitch step but does NOT come with a pin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Honda Ridgeline so my wife could step up to access the bed. It looks nice and seems to be good quality. However, it does not come with a pin which required an additional trip to the store. They should be clear that the hitch does not come with a required pin.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: For the price I am totally satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive step, it is not a heavy, stout step. For this price I expected light weight and am satisfied. I'm a big guy and the step doesn't appear to care much about my 250lbs on it. I bought this primarily to give the "bump to park" crowd something to hit besides my bumper. It'll do that, was easy to install and inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: D and K

customer_reviews.title: Adds protection and looks sick!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased a new 4runner and wanted to put a step in the tow hitch. I searched and found exactly what I'm looking for with this Bully! I put it on and it looks and fits perfect! I stood on it to wipe the roof off my truck and it s rock solid and really adds a nice touch to the backend of my beautiful toyota!
customer_reviews.author: iamartimus

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and won't fall off
customer_reviews.text: Myself and my kids have stepped and jumped on this thing and it doesn't budge. It's been nice to help me gauge the distance between objects from my truck in the backup camera as well. Definitely seeing this helping in saving major cash/time if I ever get rear ended too.
customer_reviews.author: ITgirl

customer_reviews.title: Hitch pin not included
customer_reviews.text: It does the job and fits standard 2 inch tow hitch but the description should really make it clear it doesn’t come with a hitch pin. Also the caps on the ends are pretty thin so i am guessing this won’t make it through many seasons of hot and cold. BTW it uses 5/8 diameter pin which is most common on 2 inch tow hitch
customer_reviews.author: Dax

customer_reviews.title: Nice! Solid!
customer_reviews.text: The hitch step is very nice, feels solid, it’s easy to install and clean. It looks good, I like the protection it provides in case a car parks too close because they’ll hit the hitch step instead of the bumper on my new truck.
customer_reviews.author: Al M. R.

customer_reviews.title: Loose and Leaning
customer_reviews.text: It was fabricated poorly. It was welded out of level. It leans down on one side. Out of the package it is very loose in receiver. It came with a pack of foam stickers to fill the voids. I used black vinyl electrical tape wrapped around all sides equally before I noticed the lean. Didn't want to waste the tape so living with the lean for now. Bad advertisement for Bully to people who notice.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Thought it was cool, until it starting fading and falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this at first but then after just less than a year the plastic was faded badly and the rubber end caps were ripping. Cheaply made, tried to get warranty service but never got a response back from the company.
customer_reviews.author: MoSsMaN

customer_reviews.title: I have a 2015 Jeep Cherokee Trailhawk and felt the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2015 Jeep Cherokee Trailhawk and felt the need for a bumper since that vehicle doesn't really have a place to put your foot to step when you are reaching the roof rack. This did the job, however, I had to add an extra hole in the shaft of the hitch in order to have the hitch sink in "deeper" into the receiver. Otherwise, it was sticking out too far and looked odd.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: I returned it
customer_reviews.text: It is nice if you don't mind back up sensor errors. It blocks the sensors so they will not function and you get the dashboard error constantly. If it wasn't for that I would have kept it. Seems sturdy and well made if you don't have the sensors to worry about.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews4U

customer_reviews.title: cheesy!
customer_reviews.text: while it looks ok its by no means a sturdy piece. i had to wrap tape around it so it doesn't rattle its loose real loose fitting. i would return it but its to big a hassle. plus no pin was included... very cheesy!
customer_reviews.author: Ed lewis

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic. Sturdy otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic wedge fell out within a day Plastic tube cap falling off - glued on Otherwise, works as described
customer_reviews.author: JeepCh

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and way sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice,, looks great feels sturdy when stepped on and jumped on, had to test, like how you can have it in or out with holes to adjust for different trucks. My last one had one hole and stuck way out.
customer_reviews.author: lynda james

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality hitch step.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived with scratches and dents all over. The rubber top cake already peeling off. Also arrived with no hitch pin, so I used one for my other hitch. I want to return, but my wife cleaned house and threw out the box. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: jbl

customer_reviews.title: Nothing spectacular, but ok...for now
customer_reviews.text: Not as nice as i hoped. Doesn't look like it will hold up much. The rubber pieces on the ends will probably fall off and expose the crooked cuts the cover up. Painted over sketchy welds. Was certainly expecting something better. The packaging looked like someone started to open it and changed their mind
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about purchasing this product until I read the reviews. I have an F150 and it's almost impossible for me to climb into the bed so I was looking for something that would help me out. I was between this step and another brand, but the reviews kept mentioning how this step saved them in accidents, so I went for it. My step has been installed for 3 weeks and that's all it took for someone to rear end me in a parking lot. She now has some lovely scratches on her bumper, and my truck is perfectly fine! She didn't hit me too hard, but the step did what everyone said it would!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: not even close to the WeatherTech Bumpstep or what ever ...
customer_reviews.text: not even close to the WeatherTech Bumpstep or what ever they call it. Top plastic section started peeling off after first use, had to reglue with Gorilla glue to remain safe again
customer_reviews.author: JOHN M. BURKHOLDER

customer_reviews.title: Great Price, Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice product. It feels and looks sturdy. Super easy to install. The instructions suggest locking it in place with a locking pin, super easy to do. Took me longer to get it out of the package than to install it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Boston Mami

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy protection
customer_reviews.text: I liked the tubular construction and of course the step plate but the best part is the design- no longer do I have to worry about my knees. Perfect design.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: easy step and protection
customer_reviews.text: Its is a well designed step, but it was too long for my GX-470 so I had to saw 2 inches off and drill 2 additional holes. I had to buy a special drill bit for + all the work! At least drill 2 more holes on the stem!
customer_reviews.author: Edgardo W.

customer_reviews.title: Simple, clean, convenient step for 2x2 hitch
customer_reviews.text: Fit 2x2 hitch perfectly, has three holes to allow you to insert to 3 different depths. Solid, sturdy, just as it appears in photo. Nice clean profile not too large or obtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: PL

customer_reviews.title: Holes do not line up.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product last minute,( my fault) but still got it in time. When I tried to install it, I was not able to get the pin through the holes. When I inspected the part, I noticed the holes were not drilled correctly. They were so far off, the pin would not line up. I did not have enough time to return it and get another, so I grinned the holes out to make it work for the trip. Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: William Lossman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and does it’s job.
customer_reviews.text: Husband bought this to put on my new 2019 BMW X5. At first, I thought it was stupid looking. It saved me from a bump in the back from a stupid driver. Very easy to install, took him about 5-10 min. It’s strong enough for me to stand on to grab stuff all the way inside the back. (I’m petite 5’1 and less than 100lbs).
customer_reviews.author: Nancy N.

customer_reviews.title: Bully Step
customer_reviews.text: Awesome item, sturdy and well made. Im a big boy and it can easily hold me. Truck still can be parked in the garage with it on. I did buy a lock to put on it so no one would steal it. Looks sharp on the truck.
customer_reviews.author: JAVIER T. GARZA

customer_reviews.title: Perfect step!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this as a place to rest my foot, when putting on my golf shoes at the course, but I also have a rooftop tent on top of my Jeep Trailhawk and this step makes pulling the collapsing ladder out from the tent, a breeze. Nice product, at a decent price and it looks good, too!
customer_reviews.author: Everet D. Regal

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a girlfriend for her Subaru CrossTrek and it looks and works great. It fit perfectly into the hitch with no noise when driving. We secured it with an after market lock and it's very easy to install and uninstall. It supports body weight for cleaning snow off the roof and most importantly, it helps deter dings from cars parking too close.
customer_reviews.author: K10

customer_reviews.title: All around nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Really pleased with what I received. Sturdy feel and great protection. My only suggestion is that you buy a locking pin to keep it secure. I read reviews on the tail lite connector so I stayed away and saved a few dollars. No rattling. No issues. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy,sturdy step.
customer_reviews.text: This was my only option, this or a $200 step, plus if I get rear ended it'll save my bumper from a fender bender.do t mind the devils dandruff in the pic!!🤨😳
customer_reviews.author: Torah follower

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I own the metallic one already and have had it for several years, very durable. I wanted it in black since my truck is black, and have had the same results... durable and the paint hasn’t come off yet
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived well packaged and very pleased with purchase. Very sturdy, does not rattle. I sprayed with a synthetic wax before installing. Looks great on my 2019 4Runner
customer_reviews.author: John Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to install. Nice addition to my truck. I did though have to buy a locking pin. It doesn't come with a pin to secure it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve LaMarr

customer_reviews.title: protects your vehicle in minor crashes
customer_reviews.text: I was rear-ended at a traffic light. Moderate damage to the vehicle that hit me. No damage to my truck. The bump step sustained some damage but I was able to straighten it with the aid of a press - not perfect but still able to use it with no sign of damage. If unable to repair the bump step I would have ordered a new one. Also you won't bump your shin when walking behind your truck with a trailer hitch in the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: ronald brannon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I use bully instead of hitch ball to protect the ball from rusting. My wife loves bully as a step to grab things from the trunk since our MDX has huge and deep trunk. Great product overall.
customer_reviews.author: CrossfitJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Not entirely pleased
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in an open package with discolored end caps which I'm not to happy about. I would say the product is just "ok". It's not a true 2" receiver fit. Definitely has a lot of play. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: BCAPPS

customer_reviews.title: Strong and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Put on 2020 4Runner to protect from low speed rear end collision. Fits and looks nice, much better looking than standard drop hitch for the same purpose. Seemed sturdy when I stood on it
customer_reviews.author: R-Star

customer_reviews.title: I’m a believer!
customer_reviews.text: I got rear ended in my brand new truck today and my Bully took all of the impact. No other damage whatsoever. I ordered a new one already. I won’t drive without one ever.
customer_reviews.author: Bassman0310

customer_reviews.title: Nice good price good brand
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice the anti rattle plastic wedge is a little funny but it’s not expensive so can’t expect much. I’ll likely buy a more heavy duty anti rattle Device for the hitch. Overall looks good and functional
customer_reviews.author: MiA DA Don

customer_reviews.title: Car stopper
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these on my Ford F150 and got rear ended at a stop sign and the Bully bumper got demolished but kept the car off of my truck bumper.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: The pin fits the first set of holes but not the second.
customer_reviews.text: The second set of holes (the ones that make the step closer to the truck) do not match and the pin will not fit. I tried everything. They must be uneven . The first set of holes(which makes it project further) the pin fits. I wanted to put it in the second set so it be closer to the truck.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Perfect fit. Comes with a plastic stabilizer that is good to keep the step from jiggling. Very good construction.
customer_reviews.author: CLF

customer_reviews.title: Bully Hitch Step
customer_reviews.text: This fit perfect in my 2019 RAM 1500 Classic Quad Cab. I can now easily step on the hitch step and step into the truck bed without opening the tailgate.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY WITH IT BUT HAD TO TWEAK IT JUST A LITTLE
customer_reviews.text: OVERALL VERY HAPPY. need caps (rubber) not holding on afraid I am going to loose them. adding silicone to them did the trick
customer_reviews.author: ASHLEY

customer_reviews.title: Looks awesome
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, and makes it so much easier to get in the truck. Should have bought it a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: BRADLEY E.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried because my truck has the reverse parking sensors but, they still work with no issues
customer_reviews.author: shady350

customer_reviews.title: Really like it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect hitch cover with the added benefit of being a step. Others have remarked on added benefit of crash protection - hope I never need that but does look like it may absorb some of the impact on a minor fender bender
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Functional.
customer_reviews.text: Offers protection to most of the rear bumper and is good step. Tape wedge included doesn’t prevent rattling. However, no noticeable noise while driving.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Nice an sturdy and looks good. It has held up under the weight of a few husky folks so nice and durable.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Trailer Hitch Step
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this product. Use it when we take the tray off the car. Prevents us (or anyone) from running into the trailer hitch. Is also very helpful when loading and unloading items from the topper on our vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: catloverdawn226

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and can save your rear end
customer_reviews.text: I feared it would look stupid on my manly tahoe but it looks great. Needed a plastic shim tapped in the bottom is all. Had one on my van that saved the rear end when I backed into a pole, so I knew they can save your rear end. That one did get bent but I kept it on for 6 years. Good price, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ptoduct for standing on & helping to protect my truck from yhose that like to park to close ;-) The only thing I don't like is the top of it where you step is not rubber like I thought, it is plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Sinbad

customer_reviews.title: Good product
